title: Champions who missed the mark
body:
{{champion:266}} - Worst offender. His kit missed the mark both thematically and mechanically. Aatrox was supposed to be demon who mind controls warriors on battlefield to sink into bloodlust and leads them to victory. Bloody victory, that is. Lore just screams OFFENSIVE SUPPORT, but for whatever reason, he was made as solo laner. 
Mechanically, he is either too tanky and dealing 0 damage or he's full glass cannon who dies to first CC. There's no middle ground where he can use his lifesteal efficiently. This has something to do with his healing being too reliable, so adding more power makes him just too oppressive.

{{champion:50}} - According to lore he's extremely determined and efficient general, master tactican and stuff. There are like 2 sentences about his bird, but nothing that seems imporant. In-game we got demon-possesed bitter man with all of his abilities centered around his birdo/demon. What. Also, what is even more weird, lore portraits him as front-line fighter (his duel with Jarvan back on crystal scar?!). So is he brilliant general or man/demon frontline fighter?

{{champion:7}} - supposed to be using deception and trickery to win. Her passive and W already do this but its too defensive. She's extremely straight-forward offensive wise. She literally throws herself at her enemies... is this something she should do?
Also, her passive has much more potential. What if LB gained health equal to damage taken by her clone (only when clone dies by damage), or if her clone accumulated damage taken, reflecting it back to attackers when it dies? Of course they would need direct impact of her abilities to allow this, but it would be VERY cool.

The animation canceling actually makes sense from a fighting game perspective. Its the go to mechanic for comboing in general in fact. If anything, I wish they made her combos slightly harder, in which that you can still animation cancel, but your timing has to be perfect like in a actual fighting game. And I'm talking near frame perfection here. And if you miss, you are forced to complete her entire recovery frames before you can make another action.

Well in a fighting game, you're actually fighting against people with the same controls. 

This is weird to fight against.

That's true but in every fighting game every fighter doesn't always have the ability to cancel animations or chain abilities together. The biggest one with this is Street fighter, i hate this game but every character in it is extremely well versed and hard to play in their own way, having different combos and cancels for each one, so in a sense they do not have the same controls.

In league of legends most FIghter's have animation canceling and combo's that they can do but riven has the most, the trade off is that it is absolutely necessary to learn these in order to play her. Comboing and animation canceling is a huge part of the Fighter class in league of legends.

Small List of Fighter's:

AD: Riven, Fiora, Yasuo

AP: Ekko and Diana 

These champions all have animation canceling and combo's that while might not be different for situations (Such as with Diana's main combo) but exponentially increase the champions performance once learned and perfected.

The top Challenger player in NA for a very long time this year was Arcsecond, he mained diana and did not build her full AP instead he built her like a Fighter/Bruiser.
Regar has animation canceling, so does Elise, and Jhin, and Miss Fortune, and Ezreal..

{{champion:43}} - Despite having what I consider to be a fascinating ultimate where she even says one of her key lines each time she uses it, nothing in the rest of her kit is that interesting. As someone else said on the boards last night (that I can't remember the name of, sorry): Her entire kit is just lumps of jade frankly. Her W has the potential to be fascinating, but gameplay-wise it feels pretty janky. Her Q is such a bland mechanic - skillshot that does AOE damage when it lands, and, when Mantra'd, the exact same thing, but more damage. Her Mantra'd E in fact was my favorite part of her kit until the shield-bomb was removed, despite it doing virtually no damage (and even less when you played her in the support role). It made her feel much more unique, and it feels as if they have to keep stripping away these unique functions due to abuse or meta-shifts. It sucks :c

The original Karma was far closer to her design and story, then Riot took her off the free rotation to justify a rework and completely ruined everything interesting about her. Now she's a generic mage with nothing remaining to allude to her original identity with nearly all her damage loaded into a single skill, making her a balancing nightmare.
lets not forget she lost her fans

If you play much Karma, you will figure out the more interesting parts of her kit.

For instance, if her Mantra Q hits a unit, it'll center the delayed circle explosion on that unit, rather than where the spell actually hit them.  It will also pop when it reaches max rank, making it possible to manipulate where it lanks (this can be useful for stealing, zoning, harassing, and clearing waves).

I admit her W on its own is rather bland, but the way it combos with her passive makes it even more vital to keep it on an enemy during fights.

Her E still has interesting uses for team shields/movespeed buffs, though I miss being able to use it on minions (made each minion tank 1-2 extra turret shots, which was great for pushing.  Ofc could also be used to deny cs which was fairly unique to her).

Her ult has a little trick of its own that not many people seem to realize.  The buff from it lasts 10 seconds, but the cooldown starts as soon as you activate the ability, not when another ability is amplified.  Thus, if you know you're going to want to Mantra an ability in the next few seconds, you can activate it early to have it up a bit sooner later on.  This is fairly situational though, as the opponents can see you activate Mantra if you're visible, and then back off.

While her abilities individually can be rather plain, she does have interesting interaction with her abilities to her passive/ult and back again.  There are some other little aspects of her, but as their uses become increasingly situational, I'll end this here (unless someone asks for some more).

Oh no, I main Karma, I personally find her fun to use, just in need of some modification if we want her to actually feel better to use. I love very basic champions, don't get me wrong, but thematically she's not very advanced and could use some work to really solidify that. 

I agree that the more you use Karma, despite the very basic functions of her kit, you can find some wicked combos with her that just make her so rewarding to play. I just want her to see some positive changes outside of number increases among other things to keep her in line.

She already has a ton of utility, so it would have to just be a change in delivery method to her abilities...

I can't really think of anything specific that I'd like to be done to her though.

I'd just like some variation in her kit. Right now she just hides in a bush and pokes the living shit out of you with Q. Whenever she can she'll W you and E herself to run into you. 

It's pretty binary, like Blitzcrank or Soraka. Which isn't necessarily bad, but with Karma, there's a lot to work with
